title: Ilya Kabakov, whose art punctured Soviet propaganda, dies at 89
description: Mr. Kabakov was renowned for his immersive installations that told bleak stories of life under Communism.

title: Photos: Rescue, destruction in flooded Ukrainian region
description: Rescue efforts continue in southern Ukraine in the wake of the collapse of the Kakhovka dam.

title: Memorial to mark site where Kenya starvation cult left at least 250 dead
description: The site will ensure that “Kenyans and the world do not forget what happened there,” Kenya’s interior minister said of the forest where followers of Paul Mackenzie lived and died.

title: Will Prince Harry win his court case — and change tabloid behavior?
description: In Harry’s words, the behavior of the tabloids has been “utterly vile.” But he is suing the newspapers for hacking, not for being mean, nosy or wrong.

title: Live updates: Eastern U.S. air quality reaches harmful levels as Canadian wildfires rage
description: Toxic haze from wildfires ravaging Canada has blown into major urban areas. New York, Detroit and Toronto were among the 10 cities with the world's worst air quality.

title: As flood engulfs Kherson combat zone, Ukraine claims troop advances in east
description: The destruction of the Kakkovka dam inundated towns and villages in southern Ukraine and quickly forced recalculation of battlefield plans for Kyiv and Moscow.

title: What to know about the Canadian wildfires affecting parts of the U.S.
description: Smoke and haze from the Canadian forest wildfires have also affected parts of the United States, prompting alerts from New York to Minnesota.

title: Ukraine flood victims panic as occupying Russian officials fail to send help
description: Residents of Russian-occupied areas of south Ukraine, inundated after a catastrophic dam collapse, described a chaotic situation with some trapped on rooftops and no sign of aid.

title: Pope Francis to have intestinal surgery, Vatican says
description: The Vatican said the procedure was designed to address an intestinal obstruction caused by a “painful” hernia and he would be hospitalized for several days.

title: Hit Netflix show sparks a wave of #MeToo allegations in Taiwan
description: Taiwan is going through a #MeToo reckoning, brought about by the political drama "Wave Makers," which is having real-life repercussions in the lead-up to elections.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Mass evacuations from flooded Kherson; leak shows U.S. knew Kyiv planned Nord Stream attack
description: The damage and flooding in southern Ukraine after a breach in the Kakhovka dam is likely to hurt the interests of both Russia and Ukraine, experts said.

title: A Ukrainian zoo survived through war. The Kakhovka flood ended it.
description: Residents of occupied southern Ukraine rallied to support a zoo through the war, but only its ducks and swans survived the destruction of the Kakhovka dam.

title: A veteran Asian diplomat bows out of Washington
description: Ashok Mirpuri retired last week after more than a decade as Singapore’s ambassador to the United States. He spoke to Today’s WorldView.
